name: Hilsha Fish
description: A popular fish in Bangladesh, cooked in various ways including curries and fried dishes.

name: Biryani
description: A flavorful rice dish cooked with meat, spices, and sometimes vegetables.

name: Chapli Kabab
description: A type of kebab made with ground meat and spices, usually served with naan or rice.

name: Pitha
description: A type of sweet or savory cake made from rice flour and filled with various ingredients such as coconut, date palm jaggery, and sesame seeds.

name: Fuchka
description: A popular street food consisting of crispy shells filled with a spicy mixture of mashed potatoes, chickpeas, and tamarind water.

name: Beef Tehari
description: A spicy beef and rice dish, often served with a side of salad and pickles.

name: Bhuna Khichuri
description: A spicy rice and lentil dish, often served with meat and vegetables.

name: Shorshe Ilish
description: The turmeric in the sauce gives the dish a vibrant yellow color and a slightly earthy taste.

name: Rasmalai
description: Rasmalai is a sweet and creamy dessert that is popular in Bangladesh and other South Asian countries.

name: Chomchom
description: Chomchom is a popular Bangladeshi sweet that is similar to rasgulla, but with a slightly different texture and taste.

name: Dhokla
description: The snack is made from a batter of fermented chickpea flour (besan) and spices, which is then steamed and cut into bite-sized pieces.

name: Mishti Doi
description: It is made by fermenting sweetened milk, which gives it a slightly tangy and creamy taste.

name: Sorshe Pabda
description: The fish is marinated with turmeric, salt, and mustard oil, then pan-fried until golden brown.

name: Shami Kabab
description: The mixture is shaped into patties, coated in egg, and then pan-fried until crisp and golden brown.

name: Kacchi Biriyani
description: its made with long-grain basmati rice and marinated meat (usually lamb or goat) that is cooked together with aromatic spices,
